body:
This will be a functional call which can't be inlined. It's used in every `checked_cast` operation, so it'd be good to make it as cheap as possible.

You can avoid the call if you declare the  `extern TensorImpl*` singleton in an included header and use that (or make `UndefinedTensor::singleton` inline in a header)
body_html:
This will be a functional call which can't be inlined. It's used in every checked_cast operation, so it'd be good to make it as cheap as possible.

You can avoid the call if you declare the extern TensorImpl* singleton in an included header and use that (or make UndefinedTensor::singleton inline in a header)
body_text:
This will be a functional call which can't be inlined. It's used in every checked_cast operation, so it'd be good to make it as cheap as possible.
You can avoid the call if you declare the  extern TensorImpl* singleton in an included header and use that (or make UndefinedTensor::singleton inline in a header)
